usefulItems: plastic wrap, baking paper, rolling pin, cookie cutter, large bowl, pastry brush, baking tray (30 x 40 cm), bowl, silicone bread mat, 24-hole mini muffin tray, oven, refrigerator
title: Fruity pear mince tarts

ingredients.content: 30 g raw sugar or Rapadura sugar
130 g butter, chilled and cut into pieces
3 - 4 tsp water or orange juice (approx. ½ orange)
2 tbsp cornflour, plus extra for dusting
1 orange, zest only, no white pith
750 g pears, peeled, cores removed and cut into quarters
50 g glace ginger, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Preparation
Almond pastry
Place sugar into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add flour, butter, mixed spice, salt and reserved sugar and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>, or until mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
Add egg yolk and water or orange juice and knead <b>20 sec/<b>.
Transfer dough onto a silicone bread mat or floured work surface and work into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and place into the refrigerator to rest until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Marzipan shapes
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and mill <b>15 sec/speed 7<b>.

Add all remaining marzipan ingredients, including reserved sugar, and mix <b>40 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Repeat mixing if necessary. If mixture is sticky, add a little more cornflour.

Transfer mixture onto a silicone bread mat or work surface dusted with cornflour. Knead mixture until well combined using the warmth of your hands to help soften and release the oil from the almonds, this will help to bind the dough before rolling. Roll out mixture until 5 mm thick, then using a cookie cutter, cut out marzipan into your festive shapes of choice. Place shapes onto prepared baking tray. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Bake for 5 minutes (180°C) or until lightly golden, then set aside to cool (see Tip).
Mince filling
Increase oven temperature to 200°C and lightly grease a 24-hole mini muffin tray and set aside.
Place orange zest into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>.
Add pears and sugar and chop <b>3 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add all remaining mince filling ingredients, except brandy and egg, and cook <b>35 min/Varoma//speed 1<b>. Transfer mince filling into a large bowl. Allow to cool slightly, then stir through brandy (optional) and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Remove almond pastry from refrigerator and roll out between 2 sheets of baking paper until 5 mm thick. Cut pastry to size using a cookie cutter and use to line prepared muffin tray.
Spoon in cooled mince filling and top with marzipan shapes. Brush marzipan shapes with a little beaten egg then bake for 10 minutes (200°C).
Brandy cream sauce
Place sugar into mixing bowl and mill <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk.<b> Add cream, milk, eggs and brandy and cook <b>10 min/80°C/speed 4<b>. Mixture should coat the back of a wooden spoon. <b>Remove butterfly whisk.<b>
Allow pies to cool slightly, before dusting with icing sugar and serving warm with Brandy cream sauce.

hintsAndTricks: Any leftover marzipan shapes that are not used on top of your tarts will need to be baked for an extra 10 minutes (180°C).

<b>Fruity pear mince slab<b>: make the Almond pastry and Marzipan shapes as above (steps 1-10). Make Mince filling as above (steps 13-16). Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease and line a 25 x 31 cm slice tin with baking paper. Line tin with almond pastry, then fill pastry with mince filling and bake for 10 minutes (200°C). Top with unbaked marzipan shapes, then bake for a further 10 minutes (200°C). While slab is baking, make Brandy cream sauce as above (steps 18-20).
